supportDesc.condition: The leather cover is nearly fully missing. Some fols. are damaged by water and cockled, the text is partly difficult to read. The Ms. has been resewn, the wooden boards probably inverted or even replaced with new ones. Tears are carefully amended on fols. 17, 23, 70, 75, 83. Fols. 2, 48 are mutilated (cut to half). Some of the fols. are of somewhat irregular shape, some are made out of two pieces of parchment.

handDesc.handNote: Hand a: poor, irregular; hand b: regular black; red (brilliant vermilion; dark vermilion) Täśfa MaryamMentioned as the scribe on fols. 9rb, 9vb, 43vaHand a: 18th cent. (?). Hand b: somewhat later time (?)
Hand a: fols. 3ra-48ra (Text I, quires I-VI), possibly imitates an old script.
Hand b: fols. 49ra-81ra (Text II, VII-XI): bears some similarity to hand a, but is much more regular. It cannot be excluded that both parts were written by the same scribe.

origin.origDate: Quires A and I-VI (hand a) might date to 18th century (?). Quires quires VII-XI (hand b) might date to a somewhat later period; they were possibly commissioned by the donor of quires I-VI, Gäbrä ʾIyäsus.

person.persName: Additio 1 mentiones ʾabunä Gäbrä ʾIyäsus as the donor. His name was inserted in the supplication formulas in Text I, in hand b (fols. 3ra, 5rb, 13va, 14ra, 14rb, 48ra, 49ra, 81ra etc.) alonside the names of his relatives: his wife Ḍädalä Maryam (fols. 6va, 26ra, 49ra, 54vb, 81ra), his father Mäzgäbä Śǝllase (on fols. 9rb. 11ra, 11rb, 11vb, 12rb, 54rb, 81ra, etc.), his mother Wälättä Mädḫǝn (fol. 8ra, 59ra, 61va, 81ra), his children Täklä Maryam (fols. 8va, 9vb, 11vb, 13ra, 14vb, 81ra, etc.) and Wälättä Śǝllāse (fols. 23vb, 29ra, 33ra, 68ra, 74ra, 81ra).
